title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 § 65.21 - Service of petition on the Commissioner of Labor by the Board
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 § 65.21 - Service of petition on the Commissioner of Labor by the Board

State Regulations
(a) After a
petition is filed that complies with section
65.18, the Board will serve it
upon the Commissioner, through their General Counsel. Acknowledgment of service
in a form determined by the Board will be sent to all parties indicating the
date the petition was served. (b) If the petition seeks review of a decision issued under Labor Law § 30 or
of a notice of violation and order to comply issued under Labor Law §
27-a, the Board will send a copy of the petition for informational purposes to
any representative of the affected employees identified in the
petition. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§
65.21

Adopted

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
